body: I see a trending feed and the all feed as two different things. Being on all means constantly trying to funnel readers, especially new ones, to the sub, and that's definitely something to avoid for reasons covered in the post. But to try and stay out of trending seems this side of wanting the sub a semi-private sub, and do we want to go that far? Invite only? I don't think we want to stop new visitors, we just don't want a flood of them for no good reason outside of curiosity. If they show up because there's news about India becoming lethal in heat due to climate change, why wouldn't we want more readers that care to learn more and have discussions about it?

Real talk I feel like Kendrick and Gibbs in general have more overlap with Uzi and Carti than you‚Äôd first make out. 

Sure TPAB and Bandana aren‚Äôt like WLR or Eternal Atake but Kendrick was also perfectly fine with jumping on New Freezer and Mask Off or Keems tracks.

Posting pictures of family in the classroom is crossing student-teacher boundaries.

Parents are to be informed of all communications between the student and teacher.

These are principles taught in education degree curriculum, often re-enforced by school policy and state education board guidelines.

What we are seeing here is an attempt to politicize the classroom which is inappropriate and unprofessional.

Regardless of which side a teacher takes, it will isolate some students.  Classrooms are supposed to be neutral.  However we are seeing a rise in unprofessional behavior of teachers who wish to bring their personal politics into the classroom.

Not disagreeing at all but I have an interesting anecdote that goes against this. My friend was assaulted just off Oxford Street (about 5 metres away down a fairly big street with pubs/restaurants) and when trying to work with the police, was told that most of the cameras in that area aren't actually on and thus they had no footage despite there being a camera right there.

Found it quite strange, and am wondering whether they just couldn't be bothered with it.
